data.text:
Information about «الإتحاد‎» (Al-Ittihad) media

Newspaper Name: الإتحاد‎ Newspaper name in English: The Union Owner: Abu Dhabi Media Group Country / Region: United Arab Emirates Language: Arabic Format type: Newspaper Category: General Political alignment: None Frequency: Daily Publication Years (print version): 1969 — now (54 years) Publication Years (digital version): 1996 — now (27 years) Circulation: 109,000 (2015) Official Pages: Official Apps:

«Al-Ittihad» is the oldest and longest-running Arabic-language newspaper in the United Arab Emirates, with its first issue published on October 20, 1969. Translated into English, its name means «Union». At first, it was published on 12 pages as a weekly and distributed free of charge, since 1971-every day. The classic issue of «Al-Ittihad» consists of 30 pages. The newspaper is distributed in all major cities of the Emirates, including Abu Dhabi and Dubai, as well as in other countries of the Persian Gulf, in Lebanon (Beirut), Egypt (Cairo). It is interesting that it shares its title of «oldest newspaper» with the «الخليج‎‎», which began publishing in 1970. The newspaper has its own printing houses in Dubai and Abu Dhabi, which are considered the largest in the entire Middle East. The editorial staff has been using satellite technologies to transmit the same issues to the printing house since 1981.
